subEntries.title: milGevIQ
subEntries.text: Matrox Imaging Library (MIL) X Update 130 Matrox GevIQ Smart GigE Vision Adapter release notes May 2023 ?(c) Copyright Matrox Electronic Systems Ltd., 1992-2023.   This document outlines what is new with the MIL X driver for Matrox GevIQ and explains the current limitations and particularities.   It also presents last-minute information that did not make it into the manual or on-line help. Note that this document serves to complement your manual. The information found in this document overrides your formally documented material. Contents 1.???? MIL X Driver for Matrox GevIQ Smart GigE Vision Adapter 1.1???????? What?s new in MIL X Update 130 1.1.1????? Standards compliance 1.1.2????? Known issues and particularities 2.???? Supported operating system 3.???? Location of examples (in the help file)   1.     MIL X Driver for Matrox GevIQ Smart GigE Vision Adapter 1.1         What?s new in MIL X Update 130 This is the first release of the Matrox GevIQ Smart GigE Vision Adapter.   MIL X Update 130 requires MIL X Service Pack 6 (SP6). Moreover, this update was validated using MIL(-Lite) X Version 22H1. 1.1.1        Standards compliance   Matrox GevIQ Smart GigE Vision Adapter supports the following standards: ?         GigE Vision? Standard version 2.2 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.4.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.6 1.1.2        Known issues and particularities   ?         M_GRAB buffers are allocated in paged memory by default. ?         Under the following conditions CPU usage will be higher because of post-processing: o   Camera PixelFormat is a YUV format, and a color-space conversion is required. o   Camera streams in legacy Chunk Data payload type. ?         The following digitizer controls are disabled when the payload transmitted by the camera is not a ?image? payload type as defined in the GigE Vision specification: o   M_GRAB_SCALE_X o   M_GRAB_SCALE_X o   M_SOURCE_SIZE_X o   M_SOURCE_SIZE_Y o   M_SOURCE_OFFSET_X o   M_SOURCE_OFFSET_Y ?         M_GRAB_DIRECTION_X and M_GRAB_DIRECTION_Y digitizer controls are mapped to ?ReverseX? and ?ReverseY? camera features if available. ?         The number of stream channels currently supported is 8. ?         Microsoft kernel DMA protection is not supported. See Kernel DMA Protection | Microsoft Learn for details. Disable kernel DMA protection in the UEFI/BIOS in the event the GevIQ driver fails to start with Code 55. ?         Legacy GUI applications such as Matrox Intellicam and Matrox Capture Assistant are not supported. ?         Packet resends is not supported. 2.     Supported operating system Windows? 10 64-bit Version 1809 and 22H2. Windows? 11 64-bit Version 22H2. 3.     Location of examples (in the help file) In the help file, the location information written at the top of examples might not be up-to-date. Use MIL Example Launcher to find an example on disk.
